pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:0.5: 18. The training rule on upper stories
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.2: At that time two monks were staying in a dwelling with an upper story belonging to the Sangha, one staying below and one above.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.3: The monk above sat down suddenly on a bed with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.4: A leg fell off and hit the monk below on the head.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.8: and he told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.9: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.10: “How can a monk sit down suddenly on a bed with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.11: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.12: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.15: “… Foolish man, how can you sit down suddenly on a bed with detachable legs on a upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.17: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.18.1: ‘If a monk sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.4: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.5: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.6: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.8: a man of average height does not hit his head.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.14: if he sits down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.16: if he lies down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.1: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on the upper story, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.2: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.3: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on the upper story, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.4: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.5: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.6: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.7: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.2: if there is no upper story;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.3: if the upper story is so low that one hits the head;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.4: if the lower story is not in use;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.5: if the upper story has floorboards;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.6: if bolts to fasten the legs have been applied,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.7: if he stands on it to get hold of something or to put something up;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.10: The eighth rule, the training rule on upper stories, is finished.
